intro: Cystostemon somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali cypress, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Somalia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive cone-like structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and exhibits a slow growth rate. Its botanical features include small, leathery leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into woody capsules. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
